bwwExcerpt: By the end of the play, Holiday is so high and worn out that McDonald can really get rough and sloppy with her line delivery, and that extra texture is what the rest of the script needs. McDonald still reaches a place of real pain and despair, though, and the tragedy of Lady Day At Emerson's Bar & Grill is seeing the bright firecracker from the start of the play fade into the dark place within herself. It's a change that comes through clearly in McDonald's body and voice, and despite the faults
